data.md:MetaData: (Appendix 3) Stable oxygen isotope record of Globigerina bulloides and abundance of Neogloboquadrina pachyderma in sediment core MD99-2341

segments I to XIII. Site is located on a shallow terrace at depth near the top of the recent MOW. The location is not far from Gibraltar Strait, and it was chosen to gain a proximal MOW signature. High sedimentation rates of approximately 30 cm/kyr on average also allow the assessment of the MOW endmember properties with high resolution. A conventional gravity core of 5.77 m was taken during R/V METEOR cruise M39/1 in April 1997 (1). This record goes back to the last Glacial Maximum, approximately 18 ka B.P.
Position of the Polar Front along the western Iberian margin during key cold episodes of the last 45 ka
